definitions: A member of a group of English Protestants of the late 16th and 17th centuries who regarded the Reformation of the Church of England under Elizabeth I as incomplete and sought to simplify and regulate forms of worship and, to some extent, aspects of daily life.
A person with an often censorious moral strictness and austerity.
examples: Many Puritans emigrated to New England.
His lifestyle was that of a true Puritan.
